channel.title: Xp rate

item.title: Xp rate
item.dc:creator: @frenkerscape frenkerscape
item.description:
@frenkerscape wrote:

my code look like this:

         double TotalExp = 0;
      if (UseBow || UseCrossBow) {
        TotalExp = (double)(XPrate*XPperhit*hitDiff);
        TotalExp = (double)(TotalExp*CombatExpRate);
        addSkillXP((int)(TotalExp), 4);
      } else if (FightType != 3) {
        TotalExp = (double)(XPrate*XPperhit*hitDiff);
        TotalExp = (double)(TotalExp*CombatExpRate);
        addSkillXP((int)(TotalExp), SkillID);
      } else {
        TotalExp = (double)((XPrate*XPperhit*hitDiff) / 3);
        TotalExp = (double)(TotalExp*CombatExpRate);
        addSkillXP((int)(TotalExp), playerAttack);
        addSkillXP((int)(TotalExp), playerDefence);
        addSkillXP((int)(TotalExp), playerStrength);
      }
      TotalExp = (double)((XPrate*XPperhit*hitDiff) / 3);
      TotalExp = (double)(TotalExp*CombatExpRate);
      addSkillXP((int)(TotalExp), playerHitpoints);

when i change something like TotalExp = (double)(XPrateXPperhithitDiff); to this: TotalExp = (double)(XPrate800hitDiff); i will reach in one hit level 37 or higher

Read full topic

item.title: Xp rate
item.dc:creator: @Marine5287 Marine5287
item.description:
@Marine5287 wrote:

Open up client.java and search for:

TotalExp = (double)

and you’ll see something like this:

double TotalExp = 0; if (UseBow || UseCrossBow) { TotalExp = (double) (A * hitDiff); TotalExp = (double) (TotalExp * CombatExpRate); addSkillXP((int) (TotalExp), 4); } else if (FightType != 3) { TotalExp = (double) (B * hitDiff); TotalExp = (double) (TotalExp * CombatExpRate); addSkillXP((int) (TotalExp), SkillID); } else { TotalExp = (double) (C * hitDiff); TotalExp = (double) (TotalExp * CombatExpRate); addSkillXP((int) (TotalExp), playerAttack); addSkillXP((int) (TotalExp), playerDefence); addSkillXP((int) (TotalExp), playerStrength); } TotalExp = (double) (D * hitDiff); TotalExp = (double) (TotalExp * CombatExpRate); addSkillXP((int) (TotalExp), playerHitpoints);

A=Range
B=Combat
C=Shared EXP Rate
D=Hitpoints

There will be numbers where the letters are, that’s the EXP rate numbers. One hit=the number that’s there.
Credits to deathschaos9’s tutorial here:

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

Read full topic

item.title: Xp rate
item.dc:creator: @kill_you704 kill you704
item.description:
@kill_you704 wrote:

What you are looking at sir is your ItemHandler… Just go to Config.java and the post above mine shows your exp rate. If you want to change the skill Xp go all the way down in Config.java and all the rates are there. Gl

Read full topic

item.title: Xp rate
item.dc:creator: @we_rushed_god we rushed god
item.description:
@we_rushed_god wrote:

go to your src.server. then you will find config.java notepad. Open that up, then scroll down till you see something like this

public static final int MELEE_EXP_RATE = 300; // damage * exp rate public static final int RANGE_EXP_RATE = 300; public static final int MAGIC_EXP_RATE = 300; public static double SERVER_EXP_BONUS = 1;
You will change the 300 to whatever you want it to be… (With this example 1 hit will equal 300 exp)

Read full topic

item.title: Xp rate

item.description:

      if (UseBow || UseCrossBow || UseRing) {
        TotalExp = (double)((XPrate*XPperhit*hitDiff));
        TotalExp = (double)(TotalExp*CombatExpRate);
        addSkillXP((int)(TotalExp), 4);
      } else if (FightType != 3) {
        TotalExp = (double)((XPrate*XPperhit*hitDiff));
        TotalExp = (double)(TotalExp*CombatExpRate);
        addSkillXP((int)(TotalExp), SkillID);
      } else {
        TotalExp = (double)((XPrate*XPperhit*hitDiff) / 3);
        TotalExp = (double)(TotalExp*CombatExpRate);
        addSkillXP((int)(TotalExp), playerAttack);
        addSkillXP((int)(TotalExp), playerDefence);
        addSkillXP((int)(TotalExp), playerStrength);
      }
      TotalExp = (double)((XPrate*XPperhit*hitDiff) / 3);
      TotalExp = (double)(TotalExp*CombatExpRate);
      addSkillXP((int)(TotalExp), playerHitpoints);
